data.title: Should Alexa read “2/3” as “two-thirds” or “February Third”?: The science of text normalization
data.description: Text normalization is an important process in conversational AI. If an Alexa customer says, “book me a table at 5:00 p.m.”, the automatic speech recognizer will transcribe the time as “five p m”. Before a skill can handle this request, “five p m” will need to be converted to “5:00PM”. Once Alexa…

data.title: Transfer Learning in Keras with Computer Vision Models
data.description: Deep convolutional neural network models may take days or even weeks to train on very large datasets. data.title: Training a Machine Learning Model in English Improves Its Performance in Japanese
data.description: Recently, we published a paper showing that training a neural network to do language processing in English, then retraining it in German, drastically reduces the amount of German-language training data required to achieve a given level of performance.
